profile.documentation: Entity query operations (i.e. finders) can be denoted by setting the query flag on the modeled operation to true (they do not require any stereotypes).

element.name: ENTITY
element.documentation: Produces a POJO EJB entity.

element.name: MAPPED_SUPERCLASS
element.documentation: Produces a POJO class annotated as a mapped/embeddable super class. This can only be assigned to the root class in a hierarchy.

element.name: SERVICE
element.documentation: Produces a Session EJB facade for the POJO EJB entities.

element.name: MESSAGE_DRIVEN
element.documentation: Produces a JMS Message Driven EJB facade that received messages.

element.name: ENUMERATION
element.documentation: This stereotype will instruct to define an enumeration class variable of type enum introduced in JDK 1.5. That way it is possible for Entities to use this enumeration type for their attributes.

element.name: VERSION
element.documentation:
Identifies an attribute as an version property (optimistic lock value) of an entity. Used to ensure integrity when reattaching and for overall optimistic concurrency control. Only one attribute per entity class is allowed to have the Version stereotype. The following types are supported:
int
Integer
short
Short
long
Long
Timestamp

element.name: TRANSIENT
element.documentation: Identifies an entity attribute as a transient attribute which is non persistent.

element.name: PERSISTENCE_CONTEXT
element.documentation: Identifies a persistence context used to express a dependency on an EntityManager persistence context.

element.name: IDENTIFIER
element.documentation: Identifies an attribute as an identifier (primary key).

element.name: CREATE_METHOD
element.documentation: Used to tag an EJB create method NOTE: However POJO constructors are used in EJB3

element.name: ENTITY_REF
element.documentation: Used to reference an entity from another entity or service.
element.appliedOnElement: A dependency going into an Entity

element.name: SERVICE_REF
element.documentation: Used to reference a service from an entity or another service.
element.appliedOnElement: A dependency going into a Service

element.name: RESOURCE_REF
element.documentation: Used to reference a resource, like a DataSource from a service bean.
element.appliedOnElement: A dependency going into a class having a stereotype of UserTransaction or DataSource, out of a Service.

element.name: USER_TRANSACTION
element.documentation: Used to inject a javax.transaction.UserTransaction resource.

element.name: DATA_SOURCE
element.documentation: Used to inject a javax.sql.DataSource resource.

element.name: INTERCEPTOR
element.documentation: Defines a custome made interceptor for the business methods of the session bean and message driven bean.

element.name: LISTENER
element.documentation: Defines a callback listener class for the entity, session and message driven beans. The corresponding entity, session or message driven beans are annotated to indicate the listener class.

element.name: SECURITY_RUN_AS
element.documentation: Represents a dependency from an actor that is identified to apply a run-as identity to the bean when making calls. It does not affect the identity of the method callers.

element.name: VALUE_REF
element.documentation: Used to generate an association between an entity and a value object class. Found attributes inside the entity as well as the value object are used to get automatically filled out. The entity will provide the helper method, also for saving a value object to an existing entity. NOTE: This should not be used any longer with EJB3 as there are no value object.
element.appliedOnElement: A dependency going into a ValueObject and out of an Entity

element.name: ENV_ENTRY
element.documentation: Used to specify an environment entry which is defined in the ejb-jar.xml descriptor and can be injected in a bean.

element.name: SERVICE_TIMER_TIMEOUT
element.documentation: Specifies whether the session bean operation as a Timer Service timeout callback method.

element.name: LOB
element.documentation: Specifies whether the entity attribute is defined as either a large binary or character type. BLOB fields represent Byte[] or Serializable types. CLOB fiels represent char[], Character[] or String types.

element.name: RESULT_TYPE_FIRST
element.documentation: Specifies the finder method parameter result type to specify the starting index.

element.name: RESULT_TYPE_MAX
element.documentation: Specifies the finder method parameter result type to specify the max or limit.

element.name: POST_CONSTRUCT
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler and will be invoked when the bean is first created, after any dependency injection is required.

element.name: PRE_DESTROY
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler and will be invoked when the bean is removed from the pool or destroyed. For stateful session beans, this occurs before the @Remove annotated method is invoked.

element.name: POST_ACTIVATE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for a stateful session bean and will be invoked when the bean instance has just been reactivated.

element.name: PRE_PASSIVATE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for a stateful session bean and will be invoked when container is ready to passivate the instance.

element.name: PRE_PERSIST
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked before the entity is created in the database and will cascade to all associated cascadable entities.

element.name: POST_PERSIST
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked after the entity is created in the database and will cascade to all associated cascadable entities.

element.name: PRE_REMOVE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked before the entity is deleted from the database and will cascade to all associated cascadable entities.

element.name: POST_REMOVE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked after the entity is deleted from the database and will cascade to all associated cascadable entities.

element.name: PRE_UPDATE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked right before the database is updated.

element.name: POST_UPDATE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked immediately after the database has been updated.

element.name: POST_LOAD
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked right after the data has been loaded from the database and associated with the entity.

element.name: ATTRIBUTE_PERSISTENCE_OPTIONAL
element.documentation: Defines the attribute non-null relationship annotations. If set to false, then a non-null relationship must always exist.

element.name: ENTITY_INHERITANCE
element.documentation:
Used to override the default entity inheritance strategy defined by the
entityInheritanceStrategy
namespace property.
Permitted values are:
SINGLE_TABLE - table per hierarchy.
TABLE_PER_CLASS - table per class in hierarchy.
JOINED - Table per class.
The tagged value of @andromda.persistence.inheritance is set on the base/root class. All subclasses must then follow the same strategy. The default strategy is defined by the
entityInheritanceStrategy
namespace property.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_TYPE
element.documentation:
Used to override the default entity inheritance discriminator type defined by the
entityDiscriminatorType
namespace property.
Permitted values are:
STRING
CHAR
INTEGER
The tagged value of @andromda.persistence.discriminator.type is set once on the base/root class to indicate the type of the column used for the discriminator. The default discriminator type is defined by the
entityDiscriminatorType
namespace property.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_VALUE
element.documentation: Used at the class level of an entity and is optional. This is the value that indicates that the row is an entity of the annotated entity type. It should be specified for each class in the hierarchy.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_COLUMN
element.documentation: Used at the class level of an entity and is optional. This value indicates the name of the column to be used for the discriminator. If not specified for the SINGLE_TABLE or JOINED inheritance mapping strategies, then default to TYPE.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_COLUMN_DEFINITION
element.documentation: Used at the class level of an entity and is optional. This value indicates the SQL fragment used when generating the DDL for the discriminator column.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_COLUMN_LENGTH
element.documentation: Used at the class level of an entity and is optional. This value indicates the column length for the String-based discriminator types. It is ignored for the other discriminator types.

element.name: TEMPORAL_TYPE
element.documentation: The temporal type tagged value specified on the attributes of type java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar or on finder method parameter specifying, whether to expect one of the following types Date, Time or Timestamp.
element.appliedOnElement: Entity Attribute or Entity Finder Method Parameter

element.name: FETCH_TYPE
element.documentation: Denotes whether or not to hint to the EJB3 container that the EJB relationship/property should be lazily or eagerly loaded. By default, the loading persistence is EAGER for attributes and relationships of type OneToOne and ManyToOne. Relationships with OneToMany and ManyToMany syntax are LAZY loaded. You don't need to set anything to accept these default settings.

element.name: CASCADE_TYPE
element.documentation: Specifies the override value for the default cascade setting for this relationship.

element.name: ENUMERATION_TYPE
element.documentation: Specifies the enumeration type for the persistent property or field.

element.name: GENERATOR_TYPE
element.documentation: Specifies the primary key generation strategy associated with an entity bean attribute identifier.

element.name: GENERATOR_NAME
element.documentation: Defines a unique name which is referenced by one or more classes to be the generator for an entity bean.

element.name: GENERATOR_SOURCE_NAME
element.documentation: Specifies either the table name that stores the generated ids or the sequence name which is the name of the database sequence object used to get the ids.

element.name: GENERATOR_PK_COLUMN_VALUE
element.documentation: The primary key value in the generator table that identifies the generated value from other values in the table.

element.name: GENERATOR_INITIAL_VALUE
element.documentation: Specifies the initial starting sequence for id generation for an entity PK generator.

element.name: GENERATOR_ALLOCATION_SIZE
element.documentation: Specifies the amount to increment by when allocating an id number from the generator.

element.name: COLUMN_DEFINITION
element.documentation: Specifies the SQL to create the DDL for the column or entity property.

element.name: COLUMN_PRECISION
element.documentation: Specifies the precision value for a decimal column.

element.name: COLUMN_SCALE
element.documentation: Specifies the scale to use for a decimal column.

element.name: COLUMN_NULLABLE
element.documentation: Specifies whether the underlying column for the entity attribute may be NULL.

element.name: COLUMN_INSERT
element.documentation: Specifies whether a mapped column should be included in SQL INSERT statements. Setting to false allows the column to be initialized using other mechanisms such as a value defaulted by thedatabase. Defaults to true.

element.name: COLUMN_UPDATE
element.documentation: Specifies whether a mapped column should be included in SQL UPDATE statements. Setting to false allows the column to be updated using other mechanisms such as a value defaulted by the database. Defaults to true.

element.name: ORDER_BY
element.documentation: Specifies the column name(s) that will be used for sorting the returned collection, with ASC or DESC optional. Without a value, the primary key is assumed.

element.name: ASSOCIATION_COLLECTION_TYPE
element.documentation: Used to define the mapping for EJB3 collections. This value overrides the namespace property.

element.name: SERVICE_TYPE
element.documentation: Used at the class level of a service bean to override the default session bean type which is determined by the existence of instance variables.

element.name: SERVICE_PERSISTENCE_CONTEXT_UNIT_NAME
element.documentation: Used at the class level of a service bean or a class with stereotype PersistenceContext to determine the persistence context unit name.

element.name: SERVICE_PERSISTENCE_CONTEXT_TYPE
element.documentation: Used at the class level of a service bean or a class with stereotype PersistenceContext to determine the persistence context type. This can be set to extend the transaction on a Stateful session bean for it's EntityManager.

element.name: SERVICE_PERSISTENCE_CONTEXT_DATASOURCE
element.documentation: Used at the class level of a service bean or a class with stereotype PersistenceContext to determine the persistence context datasource JNDI name. If you don't have a scoped classloader for your application, all persistence contexts defined in your system's global context are made available to all applications.

element.name: SERVICE_PERSISTENCE_FLUSH_MODE
element.documentation: Used on session bean operations to set the flush mode that determines when the changes to the changes to the database are applied in a transation.

element.name: SERVICE_JNDI_NAME_REMOTE
element.documentation: Used on a session bean to manually specify the JNDI name the remote interface is bound to.

element.name: SERVICE_JNDI_NAME_LOCAL
element.documentation: Used on a session bean to manually specify the JNDI name the local interface is bound to.

element.name: TRANSACTION_MANAGEMENT
element.documentation: Specifies the transaction demarcation strategy for session and message-driven beans. By default, this does not need to be set for CONTAINER managed transaction demarcation.

element.name: SECURITY_PERMIT_ALL
element.documentation: Specifies whether to permit all roles to execute the opertions in the bean. This can be set on the session bean or on individual operations. If set on the session bean, all operations will inherit this behaviour. The permit all tagged value will override the roles allowed. If both are set, only the permit all tagged value is rendered.

element.name: SECURITY_DENY_ALL
element.documentation: Specifies whether to deny all roles to execute the opertions in the bean. This can be set on the session bean or on individual operations. If set on the session bean, all operations will inherit this behaviour. The deny all tagged value will override the roles allowed. If both are set, only the deny all tagged value is rendered.

element.name: SECURITY_REALM
element.documentation: Specifies the security domain for role based authorization. JBoss uses the security realm to match allowed roles.

element.name: EXCLUDE_DEFAULT_INTERCEPTORS
element.documentation: Determines whether to exclude the invocation of the default interceptors for the applied business method.

element.name: EXCLUDE_CLASS_INTERCEPTORS
element.documentation: Determines whether to exclude the invocation of the class interceptors for the applied business method.

element.name: AUTOMATIC_KEY
element.documentation: Can be used in class level of an entity. If you set this to true, the class will use an automatic key generation for the defined primary key. Please note: This is currently only available in BEA Weblogic and can not be used with combined primary keys.

element.name: NO_SYNTHETIC_CREATE_METHOD
element.documentation: Used on an Entity bean to decide whether to allow synthetic (auto generated) create/constructors.

element.name: QUERY
element.documentation: Defines a hibernate query expression. Note that it's encouraged to model your query body as an OCL constraint (instead of using this tagged value).
element.appliedOnElement: An Entity operation marked as a query .

element.name: VIEW_TYPE
element.documentation: Defines the view type for a Session EJB at the class level or at the operation level for each Session method.

element.name: TRANSACTION_TYPE
element.documentation: Defines a transaction type for a method in the Session EJB or for entity EJB POJO accessor method.

element.name: TABLE
element.documentation: Defines the relational table name for entity persistence.

element.name: COLUMN
element.documentation: Represents the column name for entity persistence.

element.name: COLUMN_LENGTH
element.documentation: Represents the column length for entity persistence.

element.name: MDB_ACKNOWLEDGE_MODE
element.documentation: Represents the acknowledge mode for the JMS message driven bean. Only needs to be specified if DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE mode is required. The default mode is AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE.

element.name: MDB_DESTINATION
element.documentation: Represents the destination queue or topic name this JMS message driven bean is associated with.

element.name: MDB_DESTINATION_TYPE
element.documentation: Represents the destination type of the JMS message driven bean. If not specified, it is assumed to be a Queue.

element.name: MDB_SELECTOR
element.documentation: Represents the JMS message selector logic used when determining the messages that a JMS message driven bean is to receive.

element.name: MDB_SUBSCRIPTION_DURABILITY
element.documentation: Represents the JMS message driven bean subscription durability mode. Queues are always durable. The durability only needs to be specified on topics. By default, topics are non-durable.

element.name: CONTAINER_CONFIGURATION
element.documentation: Defines the container configuration name set in jboss.xml to configure the container for a session bean or MDB.
